intro: Senecio vernus, commonly known as the early purple coneflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small coneflowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its showy purple-blue flowers bloom in early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio vernus thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or borders.
